doc.field: Rope Makers' Benevolent Society of Brooklyn record book
Rope Makers' Benevolent Society of Brooklyn record book

This collection consists of one record book containing the printed articles of incorporation and rules and regulations of the Rope Makers' Benevolent Society of Brooklyn, as well as a handwritten roll of members. Also included are a photographic negative and print of a cloth emblem of the Society.

This collection consists of one record book containing the printed articles of incorporation and rules and regulations of the Rope Makers' Benevolent Society of Brooklyn, as well as a handwritten roll of members. Also included are a photographic negative and print of a cloth emblem of the Society.

This collection consists of one record book containing the printed articles of incorporation and rules and regulations of the Rope Makers' Benevolent Society of Brooklyn, as well as a handwritten roll of members. Also included are a photographic negative and print of a cloth emblem of the Society.

The Rope Makers' Benevolent Society of Brooklyn was a fraternal organization organized in 1821 and incorporated in 1825. Its aim was to aid widows, orphans, and distressed members. Ropemaking was one of Brooklyn's largest industries in the 19th century.
